member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.EditorFactory.CreateEditorInstance(System.UInt32,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr@,System.IntPtr@,System.String@,System.Guid@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Used by the EditorFactory class to create the Visual Studio core editor, an editor that supports data/view separation.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns . If it fails, it returns an error code.
member.param: Flags that define the conditions under which to create the core editor.

String form of the moniker identifier of the document in the project system. In the case of documents that are files, this is always the path to the file. This parameter can also be used to specify documents that are not files. For example, in a database-oriented project, this parameter could contain a string that refers to records in a table.
Name of the physical view.
An object.
Item identifier of the core editor instance.

Must be the object that is registered in the Running Document Table (RDT). This parameter is used to determine if a document buffer (Document Data object) has already been created. When an editor factory is asked to create a secondary view, then this parameter will be non-NULL indicating that there is no document buffer.
Document View object. Returns NULL if an external editor exists, otherwise returns the view of the document.
Document Data object. Returns the buffer for the document.

Initial caption defined by the document editor for the document window. This is typically a string enclosed in square brackets, such as "[Form]". This value is passed as an input parameter to the method. If the file is [ReadOnly] the caption will be set during load of the file.

Returns the Command UI GUID. This GUID is active when this editor is activated. Any UI element that is visible in the editor has to use this GUID. This GUID is used in the .ctc file in the satellite DLL where it indicates which menus and toolbars should be displayed when the document is active.
Enumeration of type . These flags are passed to Method. This value is set to 0 in EditorFactory implementation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenColor
member.summary: Provides initial values for color indices as reported by an scanner.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenColor.Text
member.summary: = 0. The default. This represents the color corresponding to the user's default text colors (the language service's list is ignored in this one case).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenColor.Keyword
member.summary: = 1. Represents the color for a language keyword (for example, "for", "if", or "else").

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenColor.Comment
member.summary: = 2. Represents the color for a comment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenColor.Identifier
member.summary: = 3. Represents the color for an identifier or name (for example, a class, method, or variable name).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenColor.String
member.summary: = 4. Represents the color for a string, typically bounded by single or double quotes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenColor.Number
member.summary: = 5. Represents the color for a number (a string of decimal or hexadecimal digits).

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenTriggers
member.summary: Specifies a set of triggers that can be fired from an language parser.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenTriggers.None
member.summary: Used when no triggers are set. This is the default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenTriggers.MemberSelect
member.summary: A character that indicates that the start of a member selection has been parsed. In C#, this could be a period following a class name. In XML, this could be a < (the member select is a list of possible tags).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenTriggers.MatchBraces
member.summary: The opening or closing part of a language pair has been parsed. For example, in C#, a { or } has been parsed. In XML, a < or > has been parsed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenTriggers.MethodTip
member.summary: This is a mask for the flags used to govern the IntelliSense Method Tip operation. This mask is used to isolate the values , , , and .

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenTriggers.ParameterStart
member.summary: A character that marks the start of a parameter list has been parsed. For example, in C#, this could be an open parenthesis, "(".

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenTriggers.ParameterNext
member.summary: A character that separates parameters in a list has been parsed. For example, in C#, this could be a comma, ",".

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenTriggers.ParameterEnd
member.summary: A character that marks the end of a parameter list has been parsed. For example, in C#, this could be a close parenthesis, ")".

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenTriggers.Parameter
member.summary: A parameter in a method's parameter list has been parsed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType
member.summary: Specifies the different types of tokens that can be identified and returned from a language service scanner.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Unknown
member.summary: The token is an unknown type. This is typically used for any token not recognized by the parser and should be considered an error in the code being parsed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Text
member.summary: General text; any text not identified as a specified token type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Keyword
member.summary: A language keyword, an identifier that is reserved by the language. For example, in C#, do, while, foreach, if, and else, are all keywords.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Identifier
member.summary: An identifier or name. For example, the name of a variable, method, or class. In XML, this could be the name of a tag or attribute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.String
member.summary: A string. Typically defined as zero or more characters bounded by double quotes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Literal
member.summary: A literal value (a character or number). For example, in C# or C++, this is a character bounded by single quotes, or a decimal or hexadecimal number.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Operator
member.summary: A punctuation character that has a specific meaning in a language. For example, in C#, arithmetic operators +, -, *, and /. In C++, pointer dereference operator ->, insertion operator >>, and extraction operation <<. In XML, assignment operator =.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Delimiter
member.summary: A token that operates as a separator between two language elements. For example, in C#, the period "." between class name and member name. In XML, the angle brackets surrounding a tag, < and >.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.WhiteSpace
member.summary: A space, tab, or newline. Typically, a contiguous run of any whitespace is considered a single whitespace token. For example, the three spaces in "name this" would be treated as one whitespace token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.LineComment
member.summary: A line comment (comment is terminated at the end of the line). For example, in C# or C++, a comment is preceded by a //. In Visual Basic, this is a single tick '.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Package.TokenType.Comment
member.summary: A block comment. For example, in C# or C++, a comment is bounded by /* and */. In XML, the comment is bounded by <!-- and -->.

member.summary: Returns text about the given span that can be shown in a tool tip.
member.returns: If successful, returns ; otherwise, returns an error code. Since this method can begin a background parse operation, a typical error code that can be returned is if the background parse has not yet finished.
member.param: [in, out] A object specifying the location in the code to get information about and returns the span indicating the extent of the identifier or expression the text represents. This returned span indicates the area a mouse cursor can be in before the tool tip is dismissed.
[out] Returns a string to be displayed in a tool tip. This string is valid only if a success code is returned.
